alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 12:59PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN WAYNE AND FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 145 PM EDT... At 1259 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 10 miles north of Rushville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Connersville, Cambridge City, Dublin, Glenwood, Waterloo, Columbia, Bunker Hill, East Germantown, Mount Auburn, Mettel Field, Alpine, Nulltown, Bentonville, Beesons, Everton and Falmouth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
